description.p: The masked man takes one arrow to the chest. Then another. Despite the beating he is taking, he simply won't go down. Suddenly, he leaps towards his attacker and takes flight, leaving acrater in the ground where he stood. Once he grabs ahold of his opponent, he lifts them and throws them into a nearby wall. He picks up the bandit's bow and snaps it in half before turning to greet his adoring fans.

Just when the goblins are about to leave, they see someone walking directly out of the burning village: an elf whose skin is wreathed in crimson flames. The last thing the goblins see is the inferno blooming from her hand.

Within the blink of an eye, the tiefling speeds past theguards, into the tower, and makes their way through thedungeon. The prisoner barely has time to realize he's being saved before he's outside of the castle walls. The tiefling stops to catch their breath for just a moment before speeding right back in, faster than the eye can see.
No matter where they may go, an empowered will always be trying to change the world. Sometimes it's for the better, other times... not so much.

Unlike sorcerers, empowered beings have not been gifted mastery over magic. Instead, they have been given supernatural strength. They can punch with the weight of the world behind them, crush boulders, and are often capable of natural flight.

There are times when an empowered's abilities might seem akin to magic, but this would be a misunderstanding. What arcane abilities they do have are built directly into their physiology. If an empowered can summon lightning from their fingertips, an autopsy would likely find significant mutations in the empowered's hands.

These powers grow and develop in ways that the empowered may not fully understand. Since no two empowered beings are exactly alike in their abilities, no one is well suited to guide them. Being innately different from the rest of their kin gives an empowered the opportunity to be a hero, but it can also lead to a life of villainy.

The key to creating an empowered is figuring out their origin story. Where did you get your powers? Did an alien crystal fuse with you after crash landing on your planet? Has an extra-planar entity chosen you as their champion?

The next important step is to determine how your empowered has responded to their abilities. An empowered can have almost any backstory or alignment depending on how they came to be who they are now. Have they had powers since birth? Did they discover them last week? Are they hiding their abilities, or reveling in them?
You can make an empowered quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Strength, and your next highest into Constitution. Second, choose the folk hero background.
As an lowercaseclassname, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d12 per empowered level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d2 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per empowered level after 1st
Saving Throws:Strength, Constitution
Skills:Choose two from Acrobatics, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Stealth, and Survival

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a spear or (b) a quarterstaff
(a) leather armor or (b) scale mail
(a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer's pack
a mask and cape with a design of your choosing

setters.set: A martial class with super powers.

description.p: The first sign that you were empowered was your enhanced strength. While you are not wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You can attempt to grapple or shove a creature as a bonus action on your turn.
Whenever you make an unarmed strike using Strength, you can roll a d8 in place of the strike's normal damage.

Whenever you hit a creature with an unarmed strike using Strength, the strike deals an extra 1d4 damage if you are grappling the target or the target is prone. This die increases as you gain empowered levels, as shown in the Pure Strength column of the Empowered Table.

description.p: Some of your abilities might require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Power save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier

Your Power save DC is {{power:dc}}.
You're a natural when it comes to feats of gymnastic strength. You gain proficiency in Athletics, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for Strength (Athletics) ability checks.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using Athletics.

description.p: Due to their unique nature, no two empowered beings are alike. As you begin to control your strength, you will gain distinct abilities known as Astounding Powers.

At 2nd level, you gain two powers of your choice. Your power options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain empowered levels, you gain additional powers of your choice, as shown in the Powers Known column of the Empowered table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the powers you know and replace it with another power that you could learn at that level.
Some of these powers might require your target to make asaving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throwDC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Power save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier

description.p: Once you reach 3rd level, the source of your powers begins to truly manifest. Choose the Conduit, Idol, Speed Demon, Titan, Vigilante, Mutant, Super Soldier, or Hybrid manifestation, all detailed at the end of the class description. The manifestation you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 13th, and 17th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Also at 5th level, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

sheet.description: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the amount you can push, drag, or lift.

description.p: At 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: Your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: At 10th level, you can attempt to grapple creatures that are up to two sizes larger than you. While you are grappling a creature that is two sizes larger than you, your movement speed is reduced to zero.

sheet.description: You can attempt to grapple creatures that are up to two sizes larger than you. While you are grappling a creature that is two sizes larger than you, your movement speed is reduced to zero.

description.p: Starting at 11th level, you have refined your raw power through practical experience. Your Pure Strength now allows you to use a d10 in place of the normal damage for unarmed strikes you make using Strength instead of a d8.

Additionally, you can unleash a wild and deadly haymaker. Whenever you make an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the strike's damage.

sheet.description: You can unleash a wild and deadly haymaker. Whenever you make an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the strike's damage.

description.p: At 14th level, you cling to life, even when most would give up. Whenever you make a death saving throw, you regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die on a roll of 19 or 20.

sheet.description: Whenever you make a death saving throw, you regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die on a roll of 19 or 20.

description.p: At 20th level, you can use this feature at any time on your turn to push yourself past your limits. Until the end of your next turn, you are immune to all damage and automatically succeed on any Strength check or saving throw you make. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before using it again.

description.p: Your powers were formed after an encounter with a supernatural elemental event, making you a powerhouse of primordial energy. These powers are difficult to control, so be careful not to hurt those closest to you.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you choose which damage type you're infused with: cold, fire, or lightning. Your chosen damage is referred to as your 'infusion damage.' You gain resistance to your infusion damage. Whenever you land an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can use infusion damage in place of the strike's normal damage type.

sheet.description: Your elemental infusion is {{elemental infusion:type}}, you gain resistance to {{elemental infusion:type}}, you can decide whether your unarmed strikes will deal {{elemental infusion:type}} damage or bludgeoning damage.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you can project a beam of vibrant and deadly energy. You can use the Attack action to attack with this beam, and it benefits from abilities like Extra Attack as normal. To fire the beam, make a ranged attack against a creature you can see within 100 feet of you using Constitution as the ability modifier for the attack. On a hit, this attack deals infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die + your Constitution modifier.

If you take damage of the same type as your Elemental Infusion, your Energy Beam becomes charged, causing it to deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die until the end of your next turn. As a bonus action on your turn, you can willingly deal infusion damage to yourself equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die. You cannot resist your infusion damage when you deal it to yourself this way.

sheet.description: As an action, make a ranged attack against a creature you can see within 100 feet of you using Constitution as the ability modifier for the attack (benefits from extra attack as normal). On a hit, this attack deals infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die + your Constitution modifier. You can use your bonus action to gain a charge for this beam that will cause it to deal an additional 1d12 damage. If you take damage of the same type as your Elemental Infusion, your Energy Beam becomes charged, causing it to deal extra damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die until the end of your next turn. As a bonus action on your turn, you can willingly deal infusion damage to yourself equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die. You cannot resist your infusion damage when you deal it to yourself this way.

description.p: By 7th level, getting close to you is dangerous. While your Energy Beam is charged, creatures take infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die if they move within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn or start their turn there.

sheet.description: While you are holding charges for your Energy Beam, creatures take infusion damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die if they move within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn or start their turn there.

description.p: At 13th level, your Energy Beam can now be sculpted into different shapes. You can use an action while your Energy Beam is charged to target each creature within a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide (your choice) with an attack using your Energy Beam.

sheet.description: At 13th level, your Energy Beam can now be sculpted into different shapes. You can use an action while your Energy Beam is charged to target each creature within a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide (your choice) with an attack using your Energy Beam.

description.p: At 17th level, as an action on your turn, you can unleash a Hyper Beam that is 100 feet long and 10 feet wide, forcing all creatures within range to make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC. This saving throw is made with disadvantage if your Energy Beam is charged. Creatures take 10d6 infusion damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Once you unleash your Hyper Beam, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

As an action on your turn, you can unleash a Hyper Beam that is 100 feet long and 10 feet wide, forcing all creatures within range to make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC. This saving throw is made with disadvantage if your Energy Beam is charged. Creatures take 10d6 infusion damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Once you unleash your Hyper Beam, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.
While druids serve the land voluntarily, nature has singled you out to be its champion. Your powers have turned you into something wild, untamed, and dangerous.
When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your creature type changes to beast and your fingernails sharpen into claws or talons that allow your unarmed strikes to deal slashing damage.
Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

sheet.description: Your creature type changes to beast and your unarmed strikes can deal slashing damage. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you grow a tail that you can use to grasp creatures and objects. Your tail has a reach of 10 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple or shove a creature; or make an unarmed strike.

Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options. If your race already has a tail, you can apply these features to your existing tail or alter your existing tail's appearance.
Your tail cannot wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

description.p: At 7th level, you can tackle your foes like a beast of prey by moving at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a creature before attempting to grapple them with a bonus action on the same turn. If this grapple is successful, you will also knock the creature prone.

sheet.description: You can tackle your foes like a beast of prey by moving at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a creature before attempting to grapple them with a bonus action on the same turn. If this grapple is successful, you will also knock the creature prone.

description.p: At 13th level, you grow razor-sharp fangs that you can use to make unarmed strikes that deal piercing damage. Once per turn when you successfully hit a creature with an unarmed strike using your fangs, you can attempt to grapple or shove the creature as part of the attack. If you successfully grapple a creature this way, the creature takes piercing damage equal to your Strength modifier.

sheet.description: you grow razor-sharp fangs that you can use to make unarmed strikes that deal piercing damage. Once per turn when you successfully hit a creature with an unarmed strike using your fangs, you can attempt to grapple or shove the creature as part of the attack. If you successfully grapple a creature this way, the creature takes piercing damage equal to your Strength modifier.

description.p: At 17th level, you can use an action on your turn to inject a powerful venom into a creature you are grappling. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your power save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d12 poison damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not poisoned.

The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending their poisoned condition on a successful save. If the creature fails on one of these subsequent saving throws, they take 1d12 poison damage. Once you use this feature to successfully poison a creature, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: you can use an action on your turn to inject a powerful venom into a creature you are grappling. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your power save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d12 poison damage and becomes poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not poisoned. The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending their poisoned condition on a successful save. If the creature fails on one of these subsequent saving throws, they take 1d12 poison damage. Once you use this feature to successfully poison a creature, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.

description.p: The Idol is a symbol that the people look to for hope and direction. They are usually everyday individuals who have had the responsibility of power thrust upon them. As such, their powers are simple and effective.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you're a humble adventurer, of simple beginnings. You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus.
Additionally, you gain one of the following proficiencies:

ul.li: Proficiency with a language of your choice.
Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools of your choice.
Proficiency with a weapon of your choice.
Proficiency with a skill of your choice.

description.p: You can choose an additional one of these proficiencies at 7th, 13th, and 17th level in this class, but you cannot choose the same type of proficiency twice.

Also at 3rd level, you can lead others by example. Once on per turn when you hit a hostile creature with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can choose a creature other than yourself within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. That creature becomes emboldened.

Once within the next minute, the emboldened creature can roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to an attack or damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack. This reaction can be taken after seeing the attack roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses. The creature ceases to be emboldened after rolling your Pure Strength die.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses whenever you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Once per round, if you land an unarmed strike during your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to embolden an ally of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you. While a creature is emboldened, they can roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to an attack or damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses. The creature ceases to be emboldened after rolling your Pure Strength die. You cannot use this ability on a creature that is currently emboldened.

description.p: At 7th level, you learn an additional Astounding Power whose requirements you meet. This power does not count against your number of Powers Known.

sheet.description: At 7th level, you learn an additional Astounding Power whose requirements you meet. This power does not count against your number of Powers Known.

description.p: At 13th level, so long as you keep fighting, your allies will stick by you through thick and thin. Whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, you become emboldened as well. Additionally, whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, that creature ceases to be charmed or frightened.

sheet.description: Whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, you become emboldened as well. Additionally, whenever you use your Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, that creature ceases to be charmed or frightened.

description.p: At 17th level, your sense of purpose gives you the strength to face down your destiny. You can use a bonus action to regain a single use of Exemplar. For 1 minute after using this ability, or until you are incapacitated, you regain a use of Exemplar at the start of each of your turns. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: You can use a bonus action to regain a single use of Exemplar. For 1 minute after using this ability, or until you are incapacitated, you regain a use of Exemplar at the start of each of your turns. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest to use it again.

description.p: You walk the line between what is natural and what is monstrous. Your physiology has been permanently altered, and now you have to live with what you are.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your creature type changes to monstrosity, and you gain the ability to morph your limbs into weapons. As a bonus action, you can grant yourself one of the following benefits:

ul.li: Bio-Sword: Your unarmed strike deals slashing damage. Once per turn when you roll damage for an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can reroll the strike’s damage dice and use either total.
Bio-Whip: Your unarmed strike deals slashing damage and its reach is increased by 5 feet. Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet while using this Bio-Weapon.
Bio-Shield: One of your forearms grows into a barrier that grants you +2 AC.

description.p: You retain the chosen benefit until you use a bonus action to either choose a new benefit or return your body to its normal shape.

sheet.description: You creature type changes to monstrosity. As a bonus action, choose one of the following properties for your unarmed strike: (a)Sword, once per turn you can reroll the damage for an unarmed strike using Pure Strength and use either total, (b)Whip, your unarmed strike deals slashing damage and its reach is increased by 5 feet. Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet while using this Bio-Weapon., or (c)Shield, one of your forearms grows into a barrier that grants you +2 AC.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, if you touch a humanoid creature that has died within the last minute, you can absorb a fragment of their identity. You learn the creature's name, age, occupation, and alignment. Once you have absorbed a creature's identity, you can cast Disguise Self at will to assume their form. While disguised as them, you perfectly imitate their voice. There is no limit to how many creatures you can disguise as this way.

sheet.description: If you touch a humanoid creature that has died within the last minute, you can absorb a fragment of their identity. You learn the creature's name, age, occupation, and alignment. Once you have absorbed a creature's identity, you can cast Disguise Self at will to assume their form. While disguised as them, you perfectly imitate their voice. There is no limit to how many creatures you can disguise as this way.

description.p: At 7th level, while grappling a hostile creature, you can use your action to adopt some of their physical properties. For 1 hour, you gain any unique senses or resistances that the creature has. This does not work for senses or resistances granted by items. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: While grappling a hostile creature, you can use your action to adopt some of their physical properties. For 1 minute, you gain any unique senses, resistances, or immunities that the creature has. This does not work for senses, resistances, or immunities granted by items.

description.p: At 13th level, as an action on your turn, you can assume the shape of an inanimate object you have seen that weighs no more than 100 pounds and takes up no more space than a 5 foot cube. You can maintain this shape for up to an hour while you maintain concentration (as if concentrating on a spell), or until you use an action to change back to your form.

You cannot move or take normal actions while shapeshifted. The only action you can take is to return to your normal form. If a creature accidentally touches you while you are morphed, you can use a reaction to return to your normal form and grapple them instantly. Once you use this feature, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: As an action on your turn, you can assume the shape of an inanimate object you have seen that weighs no more than 100 pounds and takes up no more space than a 5 foot cube. description.p: At 17th level, you can now manifest two different Bio-Weapons at once. Whenever you use a bonus action to manifest a Bio-Weapon, you can choose 2 different properties to grant your unarmed strike instead of 1.

description.p: You're fast. Very fast. Your powers allow you to move at a breakneck pace. You might be infused with the power of light, or favored by a god of speed. Either way, you leave everyoneelse in the dust.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your powers grant you supernatural speed. Once at the start of each of your turns, you can use this feature to activate your Super Speed, which grants the following effects until the end of your next turn:

ul.li: Any movement you gain by Dashing is doubled.
You ignore the effects of difficult terrain
When you attempt to grapple or shove a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, regardless of whether the grapple or shove was successful or not.

description.p: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses whenever you complete a short or long rest.

sheet.description: Once at the start of each of your turns, you can use this feature to activate your Super Speed, which grants the following effects: Any movement you gain by Dashing is doubled, you ignore the effects of difficult terrain, and when you attempt to grapple or shove a creature, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, regardless of whether the grapple or shove was successful or not.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, even without your super speed, you're still pretty quick. While you are not wearing heavy armor, you can take the Dash or Disengage actions as a bonus action on your turn and your walking speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.
Additionally, you can perform mundane tasks rapidly, allowing you to read, write, and complete tasks with artisan's tools twice as fast as the average individual.

sheet.description: While you are not wearing heavy armor, you can take the Dash or Disengage actions as a bonus action on your turn and your walking speed increases by a number of feet equal to {{athleticism}}. Additionally, you can perform mundane tasks rapidly, allowing you to read, write, and complete tasks with artisan's tools twice as fast as the average individual.

description.p: Starting at 7th level, even while you are simply standing in place, it's hard to pin you down. You can begin concentrating on this ability as a bonus action on your turn (as if concentrating on a spell). For up to 1 minute while you maintain concentration, attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: You can begin concentrating on this ability as a bonus action on your turn (as if concentrating on a spell). For up to 1 minute while you maintain concentration, attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.

description.p: At 13th level, your unbridled speed is impossible to contain. While you are under the effects of your Super Speed, your jump distance is doubled, and you cannot be paralyzed, restrained, or otherwise have your speed reduced by spells or magical effects.

sheet.description: While you are under the effects of your Super Speed, your jump distance is doubled, and you cannot be paralyzed, restrained, or otherwise have your speed reduced by spells or magical effects.

description.p: At 17th level, you can summon all of your energy to move faster than light. You can cast Time Stop without using spell slots or components. When you cast Time Stop this way, you can grapple or shove creatures without resuming time, and your attempts to do either succeed automatically. Moving a creature you are grappling also does not resume time.

Creatures that you shove while time is stopped will only begin to move once time resumes. If a creature is knocked prone or pushed into an obstacle once time resumes, they take 3d10 bludgeoning damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

Moving a creature you are grappling also does not resume time. Creatures that you shove while time is stopped will only begin to move once time resumes. description.p: You discovered your powers during a time of strife, and carried them with you into battle. Learning how to wield your powers and a weapon at the same time wasn't easy. Now that you're acquainted with both, your training shines through.
When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your wartime training allows you to combine combat expertise with sheer might. You gain the following benefits.

Weapons of War. Choose two types of weapons to be your weapons of war. Each of these weapons can be any simple or martial weapon that lacks the reach and special properties. You gain proficiency with these weapons if you don’t already have them. Any empowered ability that applies to unarmed strikes you make using Strength also applies to attacks you make using a weapon of war. You can choose an additional weapon of war when you reach 7th, 13th, and 17th level in this class.
Guardian of Steel. You gain proficiency with heavy armor. While you are wearing heavy armor, you can gain the benefits of your Pure Strength.
Power Shot. You can use Strength instead of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of your attacks with ranged weapons of war.

sheet.description: You can benefit from your Pure Strength while you are wielding weapons of war. If an empowered ability applies to unarmed strikes you make using Pure Strength, it also applies to attacks you make using a weapon of war. Guardian of Steel. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon of war, you can deal damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die to one weapon, shield, or set of armor the creature is wielding, wearing, or carrying. This damage is of the same type as the weapon used for the attack.

Additionally, you can treat shields as if they had the thrown property, with a normal range of 60 feet and a long range of 180 feet. On a successful thrown hit, your shield will bounce off of the target and return to your hand. This thrown attack counts as an unarmed strike using Pure Strength for you.

Additionally, you regain a number of hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die whenever you spend a Hit Die as part of a short rest.

description.p: Your power is so wild and vibrant that you often struggle to contain it. When this energy boils over, you transform dramatically, unleashing your true strength for a short time.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to assume your True Form for 1 minute. You exit this form early if you use a bonus action to end it, or if you are charmed or knocked unconscious. You gain the following benefits while in your True Form:

ul.li: You become one size larger, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to grow, your physical size doesn’t change but you are still considered one size larger.
You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class.
While you are grappling a creature, they take bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die at the start of each of their turns.

description.p: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 17th level, if you are grappling a creature that is your size or smaller while in your True Form, you can use an action on your turn to repeatedly slam the creature into the ground in a fit of rage. When you use this ability, the grappled creature must make either a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC (the target chooses which).

On a failed save, the creature takes 10d10 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is stunned until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not stunned. In either case, you stop grappling the creature.
Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before using it again.

When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you prefer to stalk your foes. You can use your bonus action to take the Hide action on your turn. While you are hidden from a creature, you have advantage on attempts to grapple them and can do so without you or the creature creating any noise that would alert others.
Additionally, you do your best work when you stick to the shadows. While you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can add your Strength modifier to any Dexterity (Stealth) check you make.

description.p: This simple round shield has a single star at its center. You can use your Pure Strength while wielding it.

This shield can be used as a simple melee weapon that deals 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and doesn't need to be donned or doffed with an action like a normal shield. It has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a successful hit, the shield will bounce off of the target and return to your hand.
If this shield's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient in the use of this shield.
This armor was built by a legendary artificer who gave their life to save the universe. The armor is red with golden trim, and a shining diamond is embedded in the chestplate.

Dario built a sentient entity named Silas into this armor. Once Silas deems you worthy of the armor, you become proficient with it, and can use your Pure Strength and the Flight astounding power while wearing it.
Once you are attuned to this armor, you can don and doff it instantly, as every piece of it shall fly to you and attach itself as needed so long as it is within 30 feet of you.
Additionally, while you are attuned to this armor, you can cast Eldritch Blast from the armor's gauntlets using Constitution as your spellcasting ability and without using verbal components.
Silas is neutral good, with an Intelligence of 18, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 13. They have hearing and darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.
Silas can speak telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of the armor, and can speak, read, and understand Common.

Silas was built after Dario gave up on building weapons, opting to make creations that protect rather than kill. As such, Silas will happily advise and assist their wearer when needed, but only if your intentions are noble.
This skin-tight suit is made up of dragon scales.
While attuned to this suit, you gain the Anatomical Armor astounding power. This does not count towards your number of powers known.
Additionally, you can speak and understand Draconic while you are attuned to this suit.
In order to properly attune to this suit, you must be deemed worthy of it by either a dragon, or the last empowered who attuned to it.

This dark suit of armor appears to be made out of woven threads of metal. When you take damage during combat, this armor gains a charge. Once this armor has 5 charges, you can expend them as a bonus action to do one of the following:

ul.li: Regain a use of Strength Surge.
Make a long or high jump without needing to move 10 feet immediately before jumping. The distance you can cover with this jump is doubled.
Make an unarmed strike.

description.p: This golden whip deals radiant damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die.
You can use this whip to cast Zone of Truth using Constitution as your spellcasting ability. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
If the whip's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient with this whip.
